review_blob: A really wizard concept beer, and executed in a very creative way. Bottled, drunk gently chilled. It pours like cola and smells like Pepsi, with a delightfully massive blackberry squash hit. Theres an odd hint of idodine or chlorine on the nose, which Im into. The mouthfeel is very odd, its far too thin and a bit soapy for a real porter. It helps the beer go down, but a porter like this should be more of an oral adventure. It tastes good, though. Not too sweet, but a jelly bean flavour slides pleasantly down the sides of the tongue. Jolly nice toasted biscuit base, and theres a sort-of strawberries and cream element in there too. Im a bit disappointed not to have detected the coriander in there anywhere, but its a pretty tasty beer.

In terms of aroma, this beer is a real winner - despite my cold! On the nose, there was an immediate and very serious hit of hoi-sin sauce, with a tickle of fruity jam, and a very subtle saline hint which struck me as the aroma of pork-belly. Fantastic. A lovely treacle-ruby colour in the glass, with very little head or lacing from the tap. There was absolutely no front of tongue alpha-acid kick, but the coffee lends the beer a dominating back of tongue English ale bitterness. Sweet plum flavours, a touch of latt, and a gentle yoghurty aftertaste. Jolly nice indeed.

The bottle does specify that it shouldnt be left in the fridge too long, and I wish someone had read it when we bought the damn thing. After five months of sitting at the back of our drinks fridge the thing is just a yeasty, flavourless mess. A sad waste of a very promising beer.

All I can really say is wow! Havent experienced something that purely hoppy in some time. Very smoky but not from a malt roast flavour, I couldnt quite pin where that taste came from. Very cloudy, pale appearance and a very light, marshmallowy head. Potent and a half.

Expectations were not, of course, particularly high and my initial reaction was my typical "disgusting" objection, but given a moment or two of consideration I must accept that this beer does actually have a flavour. Even if Im having to remind myself that its there with each sip. Almost entirely lacking aroma save the hint of honey, but with an acceptable sweetness and very subtle hint at some Belgian influence. Nice effort, Carlsburg. Keep at it though.
